step2.intro_html:
It looks like there are no nodes on this page yet, so let‚Äôs create a starting point (root node) to get started.

After that, try clicking one of the root nodes in the screen to open the node editor.

At the top of the node editor, click the to start the next part of the walkthrough.

step0.intro_html:
This is the page where your charts are listed ‚Äî each chart visualizes how your registered techniques connect to form match scenarios.

Organizing your charts by position makes it easier to review and keep things tidy.

That said, you can also group them by your favorite sequences or specific training themes ‚Äî whatever fits your goal best!

step1.intro_html: Click this button to create a new chart.
step1.title: Create a New Chart

step2.intro_html: You can search and filter the charts displayed in the list using this search box.
step2.title: Search

step2.intro_html: You can search and filter the charts displayed in the list using this search box.
step2.title: Search

step3.intro_html:
That‚Äôs all for this screen!

Try clicking one of the chart cards in the list to open it.

For instructions on how to operate the chart screen, click the icon next to the chart title!

step0.intro_html:
This guide will explain how to use the app.

The basic flow of usage is as follows:

  1. Register techniques in Technique
  2. Connect techniques in Flow Chart to visualize the flow of a match (your preferred patterns)
step0.title: About this guide

step1.intro_html:
In Technique, you can register and organize your techniques.

Adding your insights from sparring to each technique‚Äôs note section will help reinforce learning.

Over 90 techniques are preloaded as presets, but feel free to add new ones if needed.

The usage guide for the Technique screen can be opened by clicking the icon at the top left of the Technique screen.
step1.title: Technique: Register techniques

step2.intro_html:
In Flow Chart, you can connect the techniques registered in Technique and visualize the flow of a match.

By organizing ‚Äúwhich technique can follow this one,‚Äù you can make reviews and strategy planning more effective.

The usage guide for the Flow Chart screen can be opened by clicking the icon at the top left of the Flow Chart screen.
step2.title: Flow Chart: Connect techniques

step3.intro_html:
To start, try drawing the pathways of your preferred the flow of a match in the Flow Chart.

If a technique you use is missing, go back to Technique and add it.
step3.title: First goal

step4.intro_html:
Let‚Äôs get started!

If you ever feel lost, you can always reopen this guide!
step4.title: All set!

step0.intro_html: This section explains the node editing screen.

step1.intro_html:
Use this field to update the technique‚Äôs information.

Changes made here will also be reflected in the Technique list.
step1.title: Update technique

step2.intro_html:
Here you can edit which techniques branch out from this one.

The techniques you select will appear connected to the right of this technique on the chart.

You can also record the conditions required to transition to each of these techniques.
step2.title: Update subsequent techniques

step3.intro_html:
You can delete the node here.

Deleting a node will also remove all nodes that were connected as subsequent techniques, so please be careful.
step3.title: Delete node

step4.intro_html:
Now try creating nodes and adding subsequent techniques to get familiar with the operations!

If you have any questions or suggestions about this app, feel free to contact us from the contact page at the bottom of the screen.

Enjoy your Jiu-Jitsu life! üëã

step1.intro_html: If the technique you need isn‚Äôt listed, you can create a new one with this button.

step3.intro_html: You can also filter techniques by category.

step4.intro_html: Click a card to view or edit details of an individual technique.
step4.title: Technique details

step5.intro_html: Use the note field here to record your daily training insights!
step5.title: Technique Editor

step6.intro_html:
That‚Äôs all for this screen.

If you‚Äôd like to learn how to connect techniques and visualize them, go to the Flow Chart menu and click the icon at the top.
